Detailed Description

Header for the driver for the FRAM module.

Function Documentation

◆ FRAM_Initialize()

void FRAM_Initialize ( void  )

Initializes the addresses to be written in the FRAM.

This function must be called before any use of the FRAM.

Definition at line 96 of file fram.c.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ FRAM_ReadData()

FRAM_RETURN_TYPE_e FRAM_ReadData ( FRAM_BLOCK_ID_e  blockId)

Reads a variable from the FRAM.

This function reads the variable corresponding to the ID passed as parameter. Read can fail if SPI interface was locked.

Parameters
blockIdID of variable to read from FRAM
Returns
one of the values of the FRAM_RETURN_TYPE_e enum

Definition at line 211 of file fram.c.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ FRAM_ReinitializeAllEntries()

STD_RETURN_TYPE_e FRAM_ReinitializeAllEntries ( void  )

Reinitialize all entries in the FRAM.

This function must be called if the alignment in the FRAM is wrong due to a change in the FRAM data structue.

Returns
STD_OK if all writes successfull, otherwise STD_NOT_OK

Definition at line 116 of file fram.c.

Here is the call graph for this function:

◆ FRAM_WriteData()

FRAM_RETURN_TYPE_e FRAM_WriteData ( FRAM_BLOCK_ID_e  blockId)

Writes a variable to the FRAM.

This function stores the variable corresponding to the ID passed as parameter. Write can fail if SPI interface was locked.

Parameters
blockIdID of variable to write to FRAM
Returns
one of the values of the FRAM_RETURN_TYPE_e enum
